content.text: I said, what? She said, I was so sorry about my titties.
If you're a toilet person, can I have them for me?
Now I said, what? I knew what she said, I just wanted to hear it again.
I moved, I retired from SNL after my second death threat because I couldn't be funny with FBI guys looking for a killer.
Got it? I might get shot, but here's a joke.
I couldn't do it.
I ended up moving to New Orleans.
I saw my first New Orleans Saints football game.
I didn't know people were that big.
It looks like a car is chasing Drew Brees.
Afterwards, I say, where's the best hamburger in French Quarter?
And everyone says, it's a place called Yo Mama's.
And I go to this place to get a hamburger.
And I'm sober now.
So I'm in there eating a hamburger, really feeling good.
You know, feeling good in New Orleans, man.
And I feel a hand on my back.
It's sliding across my back.
I hear a voice say exactly like this, we thought you might want us to shoot with you.
As these two giant dudes get in the booth across from me, I knew I was dead.
I said, yeah, I'd love to hang out with you guys.
I'm just going to use the bathroom.
So I get up and go to the bathroom, and I go to the waitress, and I go, do you sit at each other's tables in New Orleans or something?
She went, no, he's a creep.
Hang on. I'll handle it.
She goes out in the street in New Orleans night.
Now, two minutes later, these guys, these cops, I'd never heard of French Quarter cops.
Different cops. Mardi Gras.
They got to be different.
So these guys, I swear that they were as big as the New Orleans Saints.
As big as the Saints, man, on these horses.
And I'm like, and they pull up.
And I said, listen, I went outside and said, Officer, there was a problem.
But I'm going to go home.
Because I don't want, you know, I love your city.
I don't want a problem.
He said, exactly like this, he said, There ain't going to be no problem.
Exactly like this he said they could be no problem.
The Terminators a black dude like the baddest ass ever is a black dude he's the term.
Because these guys were just built for this.
Now everyone in the bar knows who they are.
They're French Quarter cops on those big horses.
And everyone shuts up.
The first guy walks... He walks up to the table.
And he goes, How y'all doing? If termites spoke...
They probably sound like these guys did now.
They're like, we're doing fine.
It's a wonderful evening, and we were just going home to get to the gate.
The guy says this to them.
You know, in the French Quarter, life is all about choices.
The choices we make will determine how we live the rest of our lives.
Will you live your life as a person, for instance, who was tuned up?
We don't tune people up.
Tuned up by police mean they have a headache.
We alter. When you're altered by us, you wake up the next morning with a speech impediment.
What y'all gonna do?
The guy went, we told you we were going to your home.
We had planned to leave here already.
We were just getting up there.
And they walked out of this place.
I mean, small like...
And they walked past the guy's horse, who had walked into the bar and was watching with interest.
Like, are y'all gonna need me?
I was like, I don't play, man. I'll fuck a motherfucker up.
Like, no, no, come on.
Because they used their horses in crowd control.
He thought he was going to be in on this.
I said, hey, officer, thank you.
I never actually saw anything like that.
He went, something we do every evening.
Why don't you sit down and enjoy your dinner and welcome to New Orleans.
I said, yeah, I want to have my dinner.
I sat down and I had my great hamburger.
I started to eat and I watched him walk out the door and get up on his horse.
And he started to pull on the reins.
But just before he pulled on the reins he looks back at me and he says, by the way, I love the way you do Bill Clinton.
Thank you, everyone. Bill Clinton!

I've never felt that pressure of, like, needing to be married, needing to get married by a certain age.
The only thing I do feel... I would like to get married before I get herpes.
Which is starting to feel impossible, you guys.
One in five people... We're just starting to feel impossible, you guys.
One in five people has herpes, you guys.
So, looking around this room, there's about 500 people.
Doing the math, one in five.
2,000 people in here have herpes, you guys.
Look left, look right.
You both have it.

but I... I just know that for me, for my personality type, I could not deal with having to tell a guy that I have herpes before I have sex with him...
because I already have so much crap I have to tell a guy before we can have sex that I cannot afford to add another thing to that list.

that's when I need you to leave.

essentially, I am a little bit sad all of the time.

sort of... So we're more like in a romantic movie and less like we're on a futon.

So... number five, I love you.

you should not be seen gobbling money.

Like, you don't see Asian people eating chocolate math problems, you know what I mean?
Um, you don't see Mexican people eating like chocolate uninsured cars.
You know what I mean?
You don't see lesbians eating chocolate WNBA games.

and we just scrape out your eggs.

but I think I'm just gonna let my eggs rot in my body.

and then throw them away.

but it's not nice.

and I usually have my hair up in a bun.
